alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Gonzales; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western DeWitt, northeastern Karnes, Gonzales and northeastern Wilson Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 642 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nixon to 7 miles east of Gillett to 6 miles north of Runge. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gonzales, Yorktown, Nixon, Runge, Smiley, Nordheim, Pandora, Gillett, Cheapside, Westhoff, Leesville, Cotton Patch, Gruenau, Oak Forest, New Davy, Sample, Wrightsboro, Cost, Thompsonville and Ecleto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
